results.title: Love : earned or learned
results.creator_credit: Paul O'Toole, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Paul O’Toole’s children are the catalyst for love in his family. Having never experienced unconditional love with his own dad, O’Toole has found that love with his own children. They also lead him on many adventures.

results.title: U.S. Sweat
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Gorewitz describes U.S. Sweat as a ‘cathartic reaction to social and personal upheavals’, he transforms images of the familiar American landscape into a nightmarish, ghostly vision. Recording throughout the South and in New York, he amassed footage that reflects the American experience. Country roads, gravestones and small-town main streets seen from a car window gradually give way to an ominous vision — saturated by Gorewitz’s signature image-processing techniques and lurid, fluorescent colors — of an America dominated by industry and the military. Called a tour-de-force by The New York Times, this is a propulsive, kinetic work of rich visual and aural textures.
results.description: Gorewitz describes U.S. Sweat as a ‘cathartic reaction to social and personal upheavals’, he transforms images of the familiar American landscape into a nightmarish, ghostly vision. Country roads, gravestones and small-town main streets seen from a car window gradually give way to an ominous vision — saturated by Gorewitz’s signature image-processing techniques and lurid, fluorescent colors — of an America dominated by industry and the military. Called a tour-de-force by The New York Times, this is a propulsive, kinetic work of rich visual and aural textures.

results.title: Inspired
results.brief_description:
Aaron Purnell used to suffer with up to 200 seizures a day. When he elected to have an operation that would stop his seizures, Aaron also knew that he would also end up with a permanent disability. This is his story of living with that disability, his involvement with the Whitehorse Disability Awareness Project and how his best friend Alisha inspired him to make something of his life.
This project was funded by the Department of Human Services, (Eastern Metropolitan Region), developed and executed in partnership with MetroAccess at the City of Monash and City of Whitehorse, and Scope.

results.title: The Lucky country
results.brief_description: Bai Chan’s parents migrated out to Australia soon after they married in China in 1988. Here he reminisces about his parents’ family, life and culture in their birth country, China, comparing it to his own here in Australia.
results.description: Bai Chan’s parents migrated out to Australia soon after they married in China in 1988. Here he reminisces about his parents’ family, life and culture in their birth country, China, comparing it to his own here in Australia.

results.title: What's the name of that place you come from nan?
results.creator_credit: Rita Hinekauia Morrison and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Rita comes from a mixed cultural background but her strongest connection is with the Maori side of her family. She shares her memories and family history in this digital story so that her Maori heritage can be preserved through future generations.

results.creator_credit: Colin Colger and ACMI Digital Storytelling

results.title: Life in horror
results.brief_description: Duy ever since a child has had an obsession with horror movies - they are his life and he knows them all. He has rules to avoid real life horror situations and his philosophy on life - live it to the max!
